data.sentence: The word مِنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: to do evil, be ill natured, wicked. yashirru/yasharru - to find fault, defame. sharrun (pl. ashrar) - evil, bad, wicked, vicious ones. It is noteable that shurrun is an exceptional form of elative adjective while the measure for elative in Arabic is afa'la. shararun (pl. ashraar) - sparks of fire.
data.sentence: The word شَرِّ comes from the root ش ر ر and is associated with the meanings: to do evil, be ill natured, wicked. yashirru/yasharru - to find fault, defame. sharrun (pl. ashrar) - evil, bad, wicked, vicious ones. It is noteable that shurrun is an exceptional form of elative adjective while the measure for elative in Arabic is afa'la. shararun (pl. ashraar) - sparks of fire.

data.meanings: to whisper evil, make evil suggestions, prompt false things.. . Waswasa (prf. 3rd. p. m. sing.): whispered, made evil suggestion.. Yuwaswisu (impf. 3rd. p. m. sing.): he whispers.. Tuwaswisu (imp. 3rd. p. f. sing.): she whispers.. Waswaas (act. 2nd. pic.): whisperer.
data.sentence: The word الْوَسْوَاسِ comes from the root و س و س and is associated with the meanings: to whisper evil, make evil suggestions, prompt false things.. . Waswasa (prf. 3rd. p. m. sing.): whispered, made evil suggestion.. Yuwaswisu (impf. 3rd. p. m. sing.): he whispers.. Tuwaswisu (imp. 3rd. p. f. sing.): she whispers.. Waswaas (act. 2nd. pic.): whisperer.

data.meanings: To retreat/recede/drawback, retire or hold back, lag behind, shrink and hide/withdraw oneself, remain behind a company of people (as opposed to going with them [ syn. takhallafa] ), sneak something away (so as not to be seen), keep one back, place one behind or after, contract/draw together or make to contract/draw together.
data.sentence: The word الْخَنَّاسِ comes from the root خ ن س and is associated with the meanings: To retreat/recede/drawback, retire or hold back, lag behind, shrink and hide/withdraw oneself, remain behind a company of people (as opposed to going with them [ syn. takhallafa] ), sneak something away (so as not to be seen), keep one back, place one behind or after, contract/draw together or make to contract/draw together.
